text: San Marcos is a city in central Texas. Texas State University-San Marcos is there. It is in the Interstate 35 corridor, between Austin and San Antonio. In 2013 and 2014, the United States Census Bureau named it the fastest-growing city in the United States.Rollins, Brad. "San Marcos again named nationâ€™s fastest-growing city" , San Marcos Mercury, San Marcos, Texas, 22 May 2014. Retrieved on 22 May 2014.Rollins, Brad. "Fastest-growing city in the U.S.? San Marcos, Texas" , San Marcos Mercury, San Marcos, Texas, 23 May 2013. Retrieved on 31 May 2013. In December 2013, it was named #9 on Business Insider's list of the "10 Most Exciting Small Cities In America."Nelson, Randy. "The 10 Most Exciting Small Cities In America". Business Insider. Retrieved on 20 December 2013. == References == Category:Cities in Texas Category:County seats in Texas
title: San Marcos, Texas
